qas.question: What convention recognizes Russian in Georgia?

answers.text: Framework Convention for the Protection of National Minorities

qas.question: How many Georgians speak Russian natively?
How many Georgians speak Russian actively?
What percent of Georgia is fluent in Russian?
What percent of Georgia use Russian as their main language?

plausible_answers.text: the country's de facto working language

qas.question: What does Demoskop Weekly cite Russian as being in Ethnologue?
What was the population of Georgia in 2006?
How much of the population of Georgia had read the World Factbook by 2006?
What percentage of the population of Georgia works at home?
What status does Ethnologue have in Georgia's government?

context: In Georgia Russian has <b9_0>no official status<b9_0/>, but it's recognised as a minority language under the <a0_0>Framework Convention for the Protection of National Minorities<a0_0/>. According to estimates from Demoskop Weekly, in 2004 there were <a1_0>130,000<a1_0/> native speakers of Russian in the country, and <a2_0><b6_0>1.7 million<b6_0/><a2_0/> active speakers. <a3_0><b7_0>27%<b7_0/><a3_0/> of the population was fluent in Russian in 2006, and <a4_0><b8_0>1%<b8_0/><a4_0/> used it as the main language with family, friends or at work. Russian is the language of 9% of the population according to the World Factook. Ethnologue cites Russian as <b5_0>the country's de facto working language<b5_0/>.
